reviews.review_msg: He is not clear about what he wants. He says what he wants and when the student does it, he doesn't like it. So it is impossible to please him. Likewise, he was complaining about how the class average was a D and how it was the students' fault...if everybody is failing his class, the one/main common factor is him.

He is the best professor I've had at sfu so far. Passionate and cares about his students. He does want his students to work hard tho which is a positive as you will be rewarded for putting in effort. He is also very accessible in his office hours and gives really good feedback.
He was an awesome prof who was very passionate about what he was teaching. Always available for help outside of the class as well, and he really wanted his students to succeed.

He is well intentioned but unfortunately, he forgets that this course is meant mostly for first year students. He has ridiculous expectations and is a horrible grader. Also, he keeps harping on the same points. Very boring. Do not take this class.

This course with Charles is very good for people who really want to learn to write close reading essays and analyze texts. It isnt easy but its worth it. Readings are interesting and not that long, raise topical social questions. Charles gives thorough feedbacks for your works and helps a lot.
